articles.title: Privacy vs press freedom, through the lens of Meghan Markle - Al Jazeera English
articles.description: Can someone's human right to privacy be overruled by journalists' right to reveal information of public importance?
articles.content:
The United Kingdom is no stranger to high-profile lawsuits launched by celebrities - including members of the royal family - seeking to protect their privacy through the courts. 
Whereas lawsuits of this kind often take the form of defamation cases, the one … [+7695 chars]

articles.author: Department for Digital, Culture, Media & Sport
articles.title: Her Majesty The Queen to send a message to the nation to mark 75th anniversary of VE Day - GOV.UK
articles.description: Her Majesty The Queen will send a message to the nation on Friday 8 May.
articles.content:
• His Royal Highness The Prince of Wales will read an extract from King George VIs diary from 8 May 1945 
  • Members of The Royal Family, the Prime Minister and the Culture Secretary will take part in video calls with Second World War veterans

articles.author: Justin Harp
articles.title: Bake Off's Paul Hollywood faces backlash over his Japan travel show - digitalspy.com
articles.description: "So much disrespect."
articles.content:
The Great British Bake Off judge Paul Hollywood is facing some backlash for comments made about Japanese culture in his new TV show.
Hollywood followed up his motoring show and his various baking series with a brand new travel-based spin-off, Paul Hollywood … [+2108 chars]
